snippet.title: Massive upgrades set for key industry player
snippet.content: A MAJOR redevelopment is set to breathe new life into a busy Coast funeral parlour. Partial demolition of two buildings, new connections, a car park redesign and internal building and refurbishment are all proposed for the Drysdale Funerals parlour at National Park Rd, Nambour. Planning documents lodged on behalf of site owners InvoCare Australia Pty Ltd reveal the scale of the works. The internal reconstruction works with additions will create a new, single building, housing a foyer, reception/waiting room, reflection room, storage, office, staff room and amenities, arrangement rooms, customer amenities, reflection lounge, kitchen and chapel. A new shed replacing the one set for demolition will contain a garage with one car park, storage, coffin lift and cool room. The existing car park, currently non-compliant with Sunshine Coast Council and Australian standards, would be re-jigged to become compliant, reducing the number of parks from 40 to 34. Landscaping is proposed to cover 25% of the 2752 sq m site. InvoCare has operated the funeral home on site for a number of years and the upgrades are proposed in order to keep up with present operational requirements. The funeral parlour operates during normal business hours and "typically, one or two services would be held per day, where the facility has the capacity to accommodate up to 100 attendees to a service". Services are normally scheduled for 10am, 12pm or 2pm, and go for about two hours. InvoCare currently employs six full-time staff at the site. The proposed development will be a major upgrade for what is a funeral precinct in Nambour, with Gregson and Weight Funeral Directors and crematorium directly across the road from the funeral parlour set for a major facelift.
